canonical_explanation.text: Force is a push or pull that can change an object's motion, shape, or direction. Types of forces include: muscular (from muscles), gravitational (pulls objects toward Earth), frictional (opposes motion), and magnetic (from magnets). Contact forces require physical contact; non-contact forces act from a distance. Work is done when force moves an object. Energy is the ability to do work. Forms of energy include: kinetic (motion), potential (stored), heat, light, sound, and electrical. Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed from one form to another.
rules: Force can change motion, shape, or direction
Work: done when force moves object
Energy cannot be created or destroyed
Forms: kinetic, potential, heat, light, sound, electrical

questions.question_text: Force is defined as:
questions.explanation_correct: Force is defined as a push or pull that can change an object's motion, shape, or direction. This is the correct definition of force, as it describes the key characteristics of a force.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Force is not a type of energy, matter, or motion. Energy is the ability to do work, matter is the physical substance that makes up objects, and motion is the changing of an object's position. Force is the specific push or pull that can cause these changes in an object.

questions.question_text: Force can change an object's:
questions.explanation_correct: Force can change an object's motion, shape, or direction. When a force is applied to an object, it can make the object move, change its shape, or change the direction it is moving in.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Force cannot change an object's color, weight, or temperature. These properties of an object are not affected by force. Force is a push or pull that can only change an object's motion, shape, or direction.

questions.question_text: The force exerted by our muscles is called:
questions.explanation_correct: The force exerted by our muscles is called muscular force. This is because our muscles, when they contract or expand, apply a push or pull on an object, which is known as muscular force.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The force exerted by our muscles is not a gravitational force, which is the force that pulls objects towards the Earth. It is also not a magnetic force, which is the force between magnets, nor is it a frictional force, which is the force that opposes the motion of an object. The correct answer is muscular force, which is the force generated by our muscles.

questions.question_text: The force that pulls objects toward the Earth is called:
questions.explanation_correct: The force that pulls objects toward the Earth is called the gravitational force. This force is caused by the Earth's gravity, which pulls all objects on the Earth's surface toward the center of the Earth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The gravitational force is not the same as the muscular force, which is the force produced by our muscles, or the frictional force, which is the force that opposes the motion of an object. The gravitational force is also different from the magnetic force, which is the force produced by magnets. The gravitational force is the force that pulls all objects on the Earth's surface toward the center of the Earth.

questions.question_text: The force that opposes motion between surfaces is called:
questions.explanation_correct: The frictional force is the force that opposes the motion between two surfaces in contact. This force acts against the direction of motion and makes it harder for the object to move.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The gravitational force is the force that pulls objects towards the Earth's surface. The muscular force is the force generated by the muscles in our body. The magnetic force is the force exerted by magnets. None of these forces directly oppose the motion between surfaces like the frictional force does.

questions.question_text: Work is done when:

options.text: Force is applied but object does not move

questions.explanation_correct: Work is done when a force moves an object. This means that the force has to actually cause the object to move for work to be done.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Work is not done when a force is applied but the object does not move. For work to be done, the force has to actually make the object move. Just thinking about something or resting does not involve any force moving an object, so no work is done in those cases.

questions.question_text: Energy is defined as:
questions.explanation_correct: Energy is the ability to do work. This means that energy is what allows objects and living things to move, change, or take action. So the correct answer is option B, 'The ability to do work'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Energy is not a type of force, like muscular or gravitational force. It's also not just movement, and it's not a type of matter like solids, liquids, or gases. Energy is the power that allows things to move and change, which is why the correct answer is 'The ability to do work'.

questions.question_text: The energy of a moving object is called:
questions.explanation_correct: The energy of a moving object is called kinetic energy. When an object is moving, it has energy due to its motion, which is known as kinetic energy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The energy of a moving object is called kinetic energy, not potential energy, heat energy, or light energy. Potential energy is the energy stored in an object due to its position or state, such as a ball held up in the air. Heat energy and light energy are different forms of energy that are not directly related to the motion of an object.

questions.question_text: Stored energy is called:
questions.explanation_correct: Stored energy, or energy that is not being used right now, is called potential energy. This includes things like the energy stored in a stretched rubber band or a ball at the top of a hill. Potential energy is the energy an object has because of its position or shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Kinetic energy is the energy of motion, not stored energy. Sound energy and electrical energy are other types of energy, but they are not the same as stored energy. Stored energy is called potential energy because it has the potential to be used later.

questions.question_text: Gravity is an example of:
questions.explanation_correct: Gravity is an example of a non-contact force because it acts on objects from a distance, without any physical touch. The Earth's gravity pulls all objects towards it, even if they are far away.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Gravity is not a contact force because it does not require the object and the Earth to physically touch each other. Contact forces like muscular forces or frictional forces need the objects to be in physical contact. Gravity is a non-contact force that acts on objects from a distance, without any touching involved.

questions.question_text: When you push a shopping cart, you are using:
questions.explanation_correct: When you push a shopping cart, you are using muscular force. Your muscles apply a force to the cart, which makes it move.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Gravitational force is the force that pulls objects towards the Earth, like when you drop something. Magnetic force is the force between magnets, and electrical force is the force between electrically charged objects. None of these forces are used when you push a shopping cart - you are using the force from your muscles to make the cart move.

questions.question_text: Why does a ball fall to the ground when thrown up?
questions.explanation_correct: The ball falls to the ground due to the gravitational force. The Earth's gravity pulls the ball downwards, causing it to accelerate towards the ground.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The ball does not fall due to air, friction, or magnetic force. Gravitational force is the force that pulls objects towards the Earth, causing them to fall down when thrown up. This is the main reason why the ball falls to the ground.

questions.question_text: Why does a moving bicycle slow down when we stop pedaling?
questions.explanation_correct: The bicycle slows down when you stop pedaling because of the force of friction. Friction is a force that opposes motion and causes the bicycle to slow down and stop over time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The bicycle does not slow down due to gravity, magnetic force, or the rider's weight. Gravity and magnetic force do not directly cause the bicycle to slow down. The rider's weight also does not make the bicycle slow down. The main reason the bicycle slows down is because of the force of friction between the bicycle's wheels and the road, which opposes the motion and causes it to slow down.

questions.question_text: In a light bulb, electrical energy is converted to:
questions.explanation_correct: In a light bulb, electrical energy is converted to both light and heat energy. When electricity flows through the thin wire filament in the light bulb, it heats up the filament, causing it to glow and produce light. This process also generates heat as a byproduct.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is B, light and heat energy. Electrical energy in the light bulb is not converted to sound energy or kinetic energy. Instead, the electrical energy heats up the filament, which produces light and heat as the filament glows. Potential energy is the energy stored in an object, which is not what happens in a light bulb.

questions.question_text: A stretched rubber band has:
questions.explanation_correct: A stretched rubber band has potential energy. Potential energy is the energy an object has due to its position or condition. When a rubber band is stretched, it stores energy that can be used to do work, like snapping the rubber band back to its original shape. This stored energy is called potential energy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The stretched rubber band does not have kinetic energy or sound energy. Kinetic energy is the energy of motion, and sound energy is the energy carried by sound waves. The stretched rubber band is not in motion and is not producing sound. It has potential energy, which is the energy stored in an object due to its position or condition.

questions.question_text: If you push a wall but it doesn't move, is work done?

options.text: No, because the wall did not move

questions.explanation_correct: No, work is not done because the wall did not move. For work to be done, the object must move in the direction of the applied force.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Applying a force alone does not mean work is done. Work is only done when the force actually causes the object to move. Even if you got tired from pushing the wall, if it didn't move, then no work was done. The correct answer is that work was not done because the wall did not move.

questions.question_text: In a fan, electrical energy is converted to:
questions.explanation_correct: In a fan, electrical energy is converted to kinetic energy. The electric motor inside the fan uses the electrical energy to spin the blades, which then produce air movement or kinetic energy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. Light energy is produced by light bulbs, not fans. Sound energy is produced by speakers, not fans. Potential energy is stored energy, but a fan converts electrical energy into motion or kinetic energy, not potential energy.

questions.question_text: A magnet attracting iron is an example of:
questions.explanation_correct: The magnet attracts the iron without any physical contact, so this is an example of a non-contact force. Magnets can pull on certain objects like iron from a distance, without touching them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The magnet attracting the iron is not an example of a contact force, because the magnet and iron do not need to touch for the force to work. It is also not an example of frictional force, which is the force that opposes motion between two surfaces. Muscular force is a force that comes from our muscles. The correct answer is that the magnet attracting iron is an example of a non-contact force.

questions.question_text: Energy cannot be:
questions.explanation_correct: Energy cannot be created or destroyed because it is a fundamental property of the universe. It can only be transformed from one form to another, like from electrical to heat energy. This is known as the law of conservation of energy, which states that energy can never be created or destroyed, only changed in form.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Energy can be transformed, transferred, and used, but it cannot be created or destroyed. The law of conservation of energy states that energy can never be created or destroyed - it can only change from one form to another. For example, when you turn on a light, the electrical energy is transformed into light energy, but the total amount of energy remains the same.

questions.question_text: A book on a high shelf has:
questions.explanation_correct: The book on the high shelf has potential energy. Potential energy is the energy that an object has due to its position or state. In this case, the book on the high shelf has the potential to do work (move) if it is pushed or pulled down, so it has potential energy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The book on the high shelf does not have kinetic energy because it is not moving. It also does not have sound energy because it is not making any sound. The book has potential energy because it is in a position that allows it to do work if it is moved.

questions.question_text: In plants, light energy is converted to:
questions.explanation_correct: In plants, the process of photosynthesis converts light energy from the sun into chemical energy stored in the form of food (such as glucose). This chemical energy can then be used by the plant to grow and function.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Light energy is not converted to kinetic energy, sound energy, or electrical energy in plants. This is because plants use the energy from sunlight to produce their own food through photosynthesis, which stores the energy in the form of chemical energy (like glucose). The correct answer is that light energy is converted to chemical energy (food) in plants.

questions.question_text: When you kick a ball, you apply:
questions.explanation_correct: When you kick a ball, you apply a force to it. Force is a push or pull that can change an object's motion, shape, or direction. By kicking the ball, you are applying a force that makes the ball move.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Force'. When you kick a ball, you are applying a force to make the ball move. You are not applying energy, speed, or time directly. Energy is the ability to do work, which is what the force you apply does. The speed and time of the kick are the result of the force, not the force itself.

questions.question_text: A running car has:
questions.explanation_correct: A running car has kinetic energy. Kinetic energy is the energy of motion - the car has energy because it is moving. This makes option B the correct answer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A car in motion does not have potential energy, which is the stored energy an object has due to its position or state. Option A is incorrect. The car also has energy beyond just sound energy, so option D is wrong. A running car has energy, so option C is not correct.

questions.question_text: Friction is useful because it:
questions.explanation_correct: Friction is useful because it helps us walk without slipping. When we walk, friction between our shoes and the ground prevents us from sliding and keeps us from falling over.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Friction does not make things move faster. In fact, friction actually slows down the movement of objects. Friction is also not a source of energy, and it does not make objects lighter. Friction is a force that opposes the motion of objects and helps us grip surfaces, like when we walk.

questions.question_text: Which form of energy is produced by vibrating objects?
questions.explanation_correct: Sound energy is produced when objects vibrate and create sound waves that travel through the air. Vibrating objects, like a guitar string or a drum, create these sound waves that we can hear as sound.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Light energy is produced by the emission of light, like from a light bulb or the sun. Heat energy is the energy of hot objects, like a stove or a fire. Electrical energy is the energy of electric currents, like in batteries or power lines. None of these are produced by vibrating objects - that is how sound energy is created.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a contact force?
questions.explanation_correct: Frictional force is a contact force because it requires physical contact between two objects to work. This means the objects must be touching each other for the frictional force to be present.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Gravitational force, magnetic force, and electrostatic force are all non-contact forces. This means they can act on objects without the objects touching each other. For example, the Earth's gravity pulls on objects from a distance, and magnets can attract other magnetic objects without physical contact. Only frictional force requires the objects to be in contact with each other.

questions.question_text: Energy from the Sun is:
questions.explanation_correct: The energy from the Sun is in the form of light and heat energy. The Sun produces a huge amount of light and heat energy through nuclear reactions, which is then sent out into space as electromagnetic radiation that reaches the Earth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The energy from the Sun is not in the form of sound energy, which is the vibration of particles in a medium. The Sun's energy is not in the form of kinetic energy either, which is the energy of motion. Electrical energy is also not directly produced by the Sun, as it requires special processes to be generated from other forms of energy.

questions.question_text: Squeezing a sponge changes its:
questions.explanation_correct: Squeezing a sponge changes its shape because force is being applied to it. The sponge gets compressed and its shape is deformed, but its weight and temperature remain the same.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Squeezing a sponge does not change its color or weight. The sponge's shape changes because the force you apply when squeezing it pushes the sponge material together, making it smaller. The temperature also does not change when you squeeze a sponge.

questions.question_text: When you eat food, the chemical energy in food is converted to:
questions.explanation_correct: When you eat food, the chemical energy stored in the food is converted to energy your body can use for activities like running, thinking, and growing. This is why the correct answer is B - the energy from food is converted to energy for your body to function.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The energy from food is not converted to light, sound, or magnetic energy. Food provides the chemical energy your body needs to power all its activities, not specialized forms of energy like light or sound. So the correct answer is B, not A, C, or D.

questions.question_text: Why do we oil the chain of a bicycle?
questions.explanation_correct: We oil the chain of a bicycle to reduce friction. Friction is the force that opposes the motion of the chain as it moves around the gears. Oiling the chain helps to reduce this friction, making it easier for the chain to move smoothly and the bicycle to ride more efficiently.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A is incorrect because oiling the chain is not done to increase friction. Option C is incorrect because oiling the chain is not done just to make it shine, but to reduce friction. Option D is incorrect because oiling the chain does not increase the weight of the bicycle.

questions.question_text: Force is a push or pull.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement 'Force is a push or pull' is true. Force is a physical quantity that can cause an object to change its motion, shape, or direction. It is the interaction between two objects, where one object exerts a push or pull on the other object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement 'Force is a push or pull' is not false. This is because force is indeed a push or pull that can change the motion, shape, or direction of an object. If the statement was false, it would mean that force is not a push or pull, which is incorrect. Force is a fundamental concept in physics and is defined as the interaction between two objects that can cause a change in the object's state.

questions.question_text: Gravity is a contact force.
questions.explanation_correct: Gravity is a non-contact force. It acts between objects from a distance, without needing to touch them. The Earth's gravity pulls on objects without making physical contact with them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Gravity is a non-contact force, meaning it does not require physical touch to act on an object. Gravity acts on objects from a distance, pulling them towards the Earth's center. Contact forces like muscular or frictional forces require direct physical contact with an object to exert a force on it.

questions.question_text: Work is done when force moves an object.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement 'Work is done when force moves an object' is correct. When a force is applied to an object and the object moves in the direction of the force, work is done. Work is a measure of the energy used to move an object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement 'Work is not done when force moves an object' is incorrect. Work is done whenever a force is applied and the object moves in the direction of the force. Even if the object is already moving, applying a force in the direction of motion still does work on the object.

questions.question_text: Energy is the ability to do work.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement is true. Energy is the ability to do work, which means the ability to move or change something. For example, when you lift a book, you use energy from your muscles to do the work of moving the book.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is true. Energy is the ability to do work, which means the ability to move or change something. If an object has no energy, it cannot do any work. For example, a book on a table has potential energy, but a book that is not moving has no kinetic energy and cannot do any work.

questions.question_text: A moving car has potential energy.
questions.explanation_correct: A moving car has kinetic energy, not potential energy. Kinetic energy is the energy of motion, while potential energy is the energy stored in an object due to its position or state. Since the moving car is in motion, it has kinetic energy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement 'A moving car has potential energy' is false. Potential energy is the stored energy an object has due to its position or state, such as a ball held at a height. Kinetic energy is the energy of motion, which a moving car has. The car's motion gives it kinetic energy, not potential energy.

questions.question_text: Energy can be created and destroyed.
questions.explanation_correct: Energy cannot be created or destroyed, it can only be transformed from one form to another. This is known as the law of conservation of energy. Energy may change forms, like from electrical to light, but the total amount of energy remains the same.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement 'Energy can be created and destroyed' is false. Energy is not something that can be made from nothing or disappear completely. Energy is always conserved, meaning it can change forms but the total amount of energy in the universe remains constant. It is impossible to create or destroy energy.

questions.question_text: Friction opposes motion.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, the statement is true. Friction is a force that opposes the motion of an object. When you try to move an object, friction acts in the opposite direction and makes it harder for the object to move.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Friction is a force that opposes motion. It acts in the direction opposite to the direction of motion. So, if an object is moving, friction will try to slow it down or stop it from moving. Therefore, the statement 'Friction opposes motion' is correct.

questions.question_text: Magnetic force is a contact force.
questions.explanation_correct: Magnetic force is a non-contact force, meaning it can act on an object without touching it. Magnets can attract or repel other magnetic objects from a distance, without any physical contact between them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Magnetic force is not a contact force. Contact forces require the objects to be in physical contact with each other, like when you push or pull something. Magnetic forces, on the other hand, can act on objects from a distance, without any direct contact between them.

questions.question_text: A stretched spring has kinetic energy.
questions.explanation_correct: A stretched spring has potential energy, not kinetic energy. Potential energy is stored energy that an object has due to its position or shape. When a spring is stretched, it has the potential to do work as it tries to return to its original shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is false because a stretched spring has potential energy, not kinetic energy. Kinetic energy is the energy of motion, but a stretched spring is not in motion. Instead, the stretched spring has potential energy stored in its shape, which can be released to do work when the spring is allowed to return to its original form.

questions.question_text: Force can change the direction of a moving object.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, force can change the direction of a moving object. When a force is applied to an object, it can make the object change direction and move in a different way.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, force cannot change the direction of a moving object. This is because force is a push or pull that can only change an object's motion, shape, or speed, not its direction. For a force to change the direction of an object, the force must be applied at an angle to the object's motion.

questions.question_text: Force is a _____ or pull.
questions.explanation_correct: The answer 'push' is correct because force is defined as a push or pull that can change an object's motion, shape, or direction. Force is the action that makes things move or stop moving.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer 'pull' is incorrect because force is defined as a push or pull, not just a pull. Force is the action that can make things move or stop moving. The correct answer is 'push', which is one of the two types of force along with pull.

questions.question_text: The force that pulls objects toward Earth is called _____ force.
questions.explanation_correct: The force that pulls objects toward the Earth is called the gravitational force. This is because the Earth has a large mass, which creates a gravitational field that attracts other objects towards it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The force that pulls objects toward the Earth is not called the muscular force, frictional force, or magnetic force. Those are different types of forces that have different effects. The correct answer is 'gravitational force', which is the force that the Earth exerts on objects to pull them towards the center of the planet.

questions.question_text: The force that opposes motion is called _____ force.
questions.explanation_correct: The force that opposes motion is called the frictional force. When an object moves, there is a force that tries to slow it down. This force is called friction, and it opposes the motion of the object.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The force that opposes motion is not called muscular force or gravitational force. It is called the frictional force. Frictional force is the force that tries to slow down an object when it is moving. This force always acts in the opposite direction of the motion of the object.

questions.question_text: _____ is the ability to do work.
questions.explanation_correct: Energy is the ability to do work, which means the ability to make an object move or change in some way. This is because work is done when a force moves an object, and energy is what gives us the ability to apply that force.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Energy'. This is because energy is the ability to do work, which means the ability to make an object move or change in some way. Work is not the ability to do work - work is the action of applying a force to move an object. The accepted answer format is a single word: 'Energy'.

questions.question_text: Energy of a moving object is called _____ energy.
questions.explanation_correct: The energy of a moving object is called kinetic energy. This is because kinetic energy is the energy an object has due to its motion. When an object is moving, it has the ability to do work, and this ability is called kinetic energy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is kinetic energy. Kinetic energy is the energy an object has when it is moving. This is different from potential energy, which is the stored energy an object has due to its position or shape. To get the right answer, you need to remember that the energy of a moving object is called kinetic energy.

questions.question_text: Stored energy is called _____ energy.
questions.explanation_correct: Stored energy is called potential energy. This is because potential energy is the energy that an object has due to its position or state, like a ball held up in the air. This energy is stored and can be used later to do work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer 'potential' is correct because potential energy is the energy that is stored in an object, waiting to be used. This is different from kinetic energy, which is the energy of motion. Stored energy, like the energy in a stretched rubber band or a raised weight, is called potential energy.

questions.question_text: Forces that act from a distance are called _____ forces.
questions.explanation_correct: Forces that act from a distance, without touching the object, are called non-contact forces. This includes gravitational force, magnetic force, and electric force. These forces can act on objects from a distance, unlike contact forces which require physical contact.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer 'non-contact' is correct. Contact forces require the object to be touched, while non-contact forces can act on an object from a distance without any physical contact. Some examples of non-contact forces include gravitational force, magnetic force, and electric force.

questions.question_text: Work is done when force _____ an object.
questions.explanation_correct: Work is done when a force moves an object. This means the force must cause the object to change position or change direction. If the force does not make the object move, then no work is done.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'moves'. Work is only done when a force causes an object to change position or direction. If the force does not make the object move, then no work is done. Simply applying a force without moving the object is not considered doing work.

questions.question_text: Energy can be _____ from one form to another.
questions.explanation_correct: The answer 'transformed' is correct because energy can change from one form to another, but it cannot be created or destroyed. For example, when you turn on a light, the electrical energy is transformed into light energy. This is called the conservation of energy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer 'created' is incorrect because energy cannot be created or destroyed. Energy can only be transformed from one form to another. The correct answer is 'transformed', which means that energy can change from one type to another, like from electrical energy to light energy.

questions.question_text: The energy from the Sun is mainly _____ and heat energy.
questions.explanation_correct: The energy from the Sun is mainly in the form of light energy. The Sun produces a huge amount of light energy through nuclear reactions happening in its core, which is then radiated out into the solar system. This light energy from the Sun is what powers many of the processes on Earth, such as photosynthesis in plants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The energy from the Sun is not mainly in the form of heat energy. While the Sun does produce some heat energy, the vast majority of the energy it emits is in the form of light energy. The light energy from the Sun travels through the vacuum of space and reaches the Earth, where it can be absorbed and used by living things. The correct answer to the question is 'light' energy.

questions.question_text: Force exerted by muscles is called _____ force.
questions.explanation_correct: The force exerted by our muscles is called muscular force. This is because the force comes from the contraction and movement of our muscles, which allow us to push or pull objects.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The force exerted by muscles is not gravitational force, frictional force, or magnetic force. It is specifically called muscular force. Muscular force is the force that comes from our muscles when we move or apply a push or pull on an object.

questions.question_text: Energy produced by vibrating objects is _____ energy.
questions.explanation_correct: Energy produced by vibrating objects, such as a guitar string or a drum, is called sound energy. Vibrating objects create sound waves that travel through the air, allowing us to hear the sound.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The energy produced by vibrating objects is not heat or light energy, but rather sound energy. Sound is created when objects vibrate and create sound waves that travel through the air. The correct answer format is 'sound'.

questions.question_text: Arrange energy transformation in a torch:
questions.explanation_correct: In a torch, the chemical energy from the batteries is first converted to electrical energy, which then powers the bulb to produce light energy. This is the correct sequence of energy transformations in a torch.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect arrangement would be: Light energy, Electrical energy, Chemical energy. This is wrong because the chemical energy from the batteries is first converted to electrical energy, which then powers the bulb to produce light energy. The light energy is the final form of energy, not the initial one.

questions.question_text: Arrange a falling ball's energy from high to low position:
questions.explanation_correct: The ball starts with potential energy when it is at the highest position. As the ball falls, its potential energy is converted to kinetic energy, causing the kinetic energy to increase. Finally, the ball hits the ground, which is the lowest position for the ball's energy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Kinetic energy increases, Ball hits ground, Ball starts with potential energy. This is not correct because the ball starts with potential energy at the highest position, then its potential energy is converted to kinetic energy as it falls, and finally, it hits the ground which is the lowest position for the ball's energy.

questions.question_text: Arrange events when kicking a ball:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is Foot applies force, Ball moves, Ball changes direction. This is because when you kick a ball, your foot first applies a force to the ball, which then makes the ball move, and this change in motion also causes the ball to change direction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be Ball moves, Foot applies force, Ball changes direction. This is wrong because the foot has to first apply a force to the ball before the ball can start moving. The ball can only change direction after it has started moving due to the force applied by the foot.

questions.question_text: Arrange energy transformation in plants:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: Light energy captured, Food is made, Chemical energy stored. This is because plants use the light energy from the sun to make their own food through a process called photosynthesis. The food they make is in the form of chemical energy, which the plant then stores for later use.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Chemical energy stored, Light energy captured, Food is made. This is not correct because the plants first capture the light energy from the sun, then use that energy to make their own food, and finally store that food as chemical energy. The process always starts with the plant capturing light energy, then making food, and finally storing the chemical energy.

questions.question_text: Arrange from contact to non-contact force:
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order from contact to non-contact force is Frictional force, Magnetic force, Gravitational force. Frictional force requires physical contact between objects, while magnetic force acts across a distance through magnetic fields. Gravitational force is the most non-contact, as it pulls objects towards each other even when they are far apart.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be Frictional force, Gravitational force, Magnetic force. This is not correct because gravitational force is a non-contact force that acts across a distance, while magnetic force also acts across a distance through magnetic fields. Frictional force is a contact force that requires physical touch between objects.
